content:
• Monday, June 18, 2018
  • NCMI

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/18/2018)

    • Top gainers: NCMI +5.2%. SYNL +4.1%. NEW +3.9%. LPI +2.0%. AVLR +1.2%.
    • Top Losers: PAGS -6.7%. DEA -4.2%.  KCAP -3.4%. REDU -2.6%. DEST -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • OBSV

    ObsEva launches 4.75M-share stock offering

    • ObsEva (NASDAQ:OBSV) commences a public offering of 4.75M shares of common stock. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 712.5K shares. Price and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • VIVE

    Viveve Medical's CMRF technology shows positive effect in women with SUI; shares up 12% after hours

    • Viveve Medical (NASDAQ:VIVE) is up 12% after hours on light volume on the heels of its announcement of positive six-month data on the use of its cryogen-cooled monopolar radiofrequency (CMRF) platform to treat women with stress urinary incontinence (SUI).
    • At month 6, treated women experienced a 73% reduction in SUI versus baseline as measured by one-hour pad weight test, the planned primary endpoint of its two upcoming LIBERATE studies.
    • The responder rate, as determined by a reduction in pad weight, at month 6 was 83%.
    • The company will host a conference call tomorrow, June 19, at 8:00 am ET to discuss the results.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 6 Comments
  • KMI

    Kinder Morgan a Buy after Trans Mountain sale to Canada, Wells Fargo says

    • Kinder Morgan (KMI +2%) is higher after Wells Fargo upgrades shares to Outperform from Market Perform with a $20 price target, saying the sale of its Trans Mountain pipeline and related infrastructure to the Canadian government removes the ongoing overhang of uncertainty in Canada and improves KMI's balance sheet and leverage.
    • Proceeds from the sale should help KMI achieve a 4.5x leverage by the end of 2018, which should remain unchanged throughout 2019, as part of the company's commitment to reducing leverage over the longer term, the firm says.
    • Wells also thinks KMI could announce new organic projects that would make its growth story more visible, including a potential second Permian-to-Gulf Coast gas pipeline or a potential sale of its carbon dioxide business, which is the largest transporter of carbon dioxide in North America.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 73 Comments
  • GME

    Sycamore Partners said to be interested in GameStop

    • Sycamore Partners is one of the PE firms interested in GameStop (GME +6.8%), according to a Reuters exclusive.
    • GameStop has hired a financial adviser to help it with the sales process.
    • Previously: GameStop spikes on report of PE interest (June 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 42 Comments
  • FCE.A

    Forest City Realty jumps 14% on reports that talks with Brookfield restart

    • Forest City Realty Trust (NYSE:FCE.A) jumps as much as 14% after Bloomberg reports that the company has restarted talks with Brookfield Asset Management(BAM -0.3%) regarding for a deal with a potential price close to a $25-$25.50-per-share range that had been discussed in March.
    • The news comes three months after Forest City said it would be better off going it alone because the bids it received were too low.
    • FCE.A touched $22.76 this afternoon. On March 23, the day after FCE.A announced it ended talks with potential suitors, shares fell 6.5% to close at $19.72.  It's 52-week high of $26.30 was reached on Sept. 11, 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • TPCO

    Tronc closes L.A. Times sale; to change name back

    • Billionaire investor Dr. Patrick Soon-Shiong has closed a $500M purchase of the Los Angeles Times and San Diego Union-Tribune and other local papers from Tronc (TRNC +3.3%).
    • He's named Normal Pearlstine executive editor of the Times.
    • The closing ends a troubled chapter in the newspaper's ownership under Tronc, including labor strife and accusations of management interference. Tronc had acquired the Times and other regional California papers in 2000 for $8.3B.
    • With the divestment complete, Tronc (TRNC) is changing its name back to Tribune Publishing, the New York Post reports.
    • That change was set up a month ago and was just waiting on the sales to close, Keith J. Kelly says.
    • Tribune Publishing rebranded and re-symboled itself two years ago this month, aiming the name "Tronc" at "Tribune online content" with an eye to a more digital future. The company transferred its listing to Nasdaq from the NYSE along the way.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • LFIN

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (06/18/2018)

    • Gainers: OTCPK:LFIN +31%. PCYG +20%. CLPS +18%. NNDM +12%. CDLX +12%.
    • Losers: NIHD -11%. OIBR-C -8%. QUIK -8%. MTSL -8%. NETE -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • HDP

    Hortonworks +4.4% on partnership expansions with Microsoft, Google

    • Hortonworks (NASDAQ:HDP) announces renewing and extending its relationship with Microsoft to help enterprises move big data workloads to the cloud.
    • Customers can deploy Hortonworks Data Platform, DataFlow, and DataPlane Service natively on Microsoft Azure. Customers can also use Microsoft Azure HDInsight, which is a fully managed service powered by Hortonworks’ Data Platform.
    • Hortonworks also expands its partnership with Google Cloud, which further optimizes Hortonworks Data Platform and DataFlow for Google Cloud Storage.
    • Hortonworks shares are up 4.4% to $19.95.   
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • LPL

    LG Display -4.6% on Morgan Stanley downgrade

    • Morgan Stanley downgrades LG Display (NYSE:LPL) from Overweight to Equal Weight.
    • LG Display shares are down 4.6% to $9.08.       
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 21 Comments
  • MOMO

    Momo dips on Standpoint Research downgrade

    • Standpoint Research downgrades Momo (NASDAQ:MOMO) to Hold.
    • Momo shares are down 0.9% to $53.10. Shares are up 3.1% in the past week, 43.7% in the past month, and 47.6% YTD.       
     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 11 Comments
  • SURF

    Surface Oncology clears resistance, up 14%

    • Thinly traded recent IPO Surface Oncology (SURF +14.1%) clears resistance at ~$15 on more than double normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 732K shares.
    • The company develops cancer treatments that target the tumor microenvironment. Last week, the company announced that licensee Novartis had initiated a Phase 1 study of SRG373 in a range of cancers.
    • Previously: Surface Oncology announces the launch of an early-stage study of SRF373 (June 12)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • DHT

    Tanker stocks DHT, Frontline, Teekay Tankers surge on Wells Fargo upgrade

    • Oil tanker stocks are uniquely positioned to take advantage of a likely increase in oil production and a potentially significant boost from new fuel regulations as part of IMO 2020, Wells Fargo says as it upgrades DHT Holdings (DHT +8%), Frontline (FRO +8.2%) and Teekay Tankers (TNK +9.4%) to Outperform from Market Perform.
    • An increase in trading inefficiencies/frictions should be a positive for product tanker ton-miles, especially from storage opportunities and longer ton-miles via LSFO (sulphur fuel oil) from the U.S. Gulf coast, says Wells analyst Michael Webber.
    • The firm raises stock price targets for DHT to $7 from $5, for FRO to $7 from $5.30 and TNK to $2 from $1.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 30 Comments
  • BTC-USD

    Afternoon rally in cryptos

    • There's no particular piece of news out there, but the price of Bitcoin (BTC-USD) jumped more than $300 over the past couple of hours, now ahead 4.5% for the session at $6,751.
    • Ether (ETH-USD) +4.3%, Ripple (XRP-USD) +3.1%, Bitcoin Cash (BCH-USD) +5.2%, Litecoin (LTC-USD) +3.6%.
    • Judging by the price action, cryptos may have been left for dead by many, but adoption continues. Earlier today, the NYDFS issued a "BtiLicense" to Square, giving residents of the Empire State the ability to buy and sell Bitcoin through Square's Cash App.
    • Related tickers: OTCQX:GBTC, COIN, RIOT, OSTK, SSC-OLD, MARA, UEPS, OTC:BITCF, XNET, GROW, OTCPK:BTSC, OTCQB:BTCS, OTCQB:MGTI, OTCPK:BTLLF SRAX, OTCPK:GAHC, OTC:ARSC, OTCPK:USTC, OTCPK:BLKCF, COINB, BTC-USD, ETH-USD, XRP-USD, BCH-USD
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 14 Comments
  • INSY

    Insys continues transformation, 40% of workforce new to company

    • INSYS Therapeutics (INSY -5%) updates investors on its planned transformation from its opioid marketing-tainted past. Key points:
    • 2/3 of the board is new, all independent except for CEO Saeed Motahari.
    • Most managers are new, including those running sales and marketing.
    • More than 40% of the workforce is new, about 132 people.
    • Almost half of the field force is new.
    • NDAs for naloxone nasal spray (for opioid overdose) and epinephrine nasal spray (anaphylaxis) are on tap for 2018 and 2019, respectively.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • DBX

    Dropbox hits new all-time high, carries other recent tech IPOs

    • Dropbox (NASDAQ:DBX) shares hit a new all-time high intraday before retreating a bit.
    • Newly public tech companies Zuora (ZUO +7.7%), Ceridian (CDAY +8.2%), and DocuSign (DOCU +2.4%) are also on the move. 
    • Potential catalyst: SurveyMonkey (NASDAQ:SVMK) became the latest tech company to approach an IPO. The company submitted a draft registration statement.  
    • Dropbox shares are up 7% to $42.37. Shares gained 32% in the past week, 28.8% in the past month, and 39% YTD since the IPO.  
    • Previously: SurveyMonkey preps to go public (June 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM | 6 Comments
  • GEVO

    Gevo soars ~300% as EPA approves higher blend level for isobutanol

    • Shares of Gevo (GEVO +304.3%) nearly quadruple after the Environmental Protection Agency approves the use of isobutanol at a 16% blend level in gasoline for on-road use in automobiles, up from a 12.5% blend previously.
    • Gevo praises the decision, saying 16% blend levels will allow more RINS per gallon, high octane and many other benefits.
    • The EPA approved the higher level of isobutanol after a request from Butamax Advanced Biofuels.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM | 17 Comments
  • GEVO

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/18/2018)

    • Gainers: GEVO +323%. EGC +19%. MCF +11%. SES +10%. EPE +8%.
    • Losers: BTE -12%. SDT -11%. SDPI -9%. SHI -7%. AKG -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • HPQ

    HP launches 3D printing center in China

    • HP (NYSE:HPQ) and Guangdong 3D Printing Collaborative Innovation Platform unveil a new 3D printing center in China.
    • The Lanwan Intelligence-HP Multi Jet Fusion Technology Mass Manufacturing Center is powered with ten HP Multi Jet Fusion 3D printing systems for functional prototypes and production-grade parts. 
    • The new endeavor marks HP’s largest deployment of production-grade 3D printing in the Asia Pacific and Japan region. 
    • HP shares are up 0.5% to $23.70.  
     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMC

    Strong debut for Incredibles 2 boosts exhibitors

    • AMC Entertainment (NYSE:AMC) is up 2.40% and IMAX (NYSE:IMAX) is 2.74% higher after Incredibles 2 blows past estimates with its opening weekend by hauling in $180M in the U.S.
    • Cinemark Holdings (CNK +0.9%) is also beating broad market averages on the day.
    • Previously: Incredibles 2 shatters box office record (June 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • AGIO

    Agios launches late-stage study of AG-348 in PKD; shares up 2%

    • Agios Pharmaceuticals (AGIO +1.7%) initiates a Phase 3 clinical trial, ACTIVATE, evaluating PKR enzyme activator AG-348 in 80 adults with pyruvate kinase deficiency (PKD) who do not receive regular blood transfusions.
    • The primary endpoint is the proportion of patients achieving a hemoglobin response from baseline. According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated primary completion date is December 2020.
    • PKD is a rare inherited disorder that presents as hemolytic anemia (accelerated destruction of red blood cells).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • ARWR

    Arrowhead Pharma up 24% on advancement of ARO-AAT

    • Arrowhead Pharmaceuticals (ARWR +24.3%) is up more than double normal volume in response to its announcement that it has completed enrollment in a Phase 1 clinical trial assessing RNAi therapeutic ARO-AAT in patients with alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency.
    • Of particular note is the elimination of two planned cohorts at the 400 mg dose after "maximal activity" was observed at lower doses than expected.
    • Initial data will be submitted for presentation at The Liver Meeting in November.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 7 Comments
  • ENGIY

    Engie sees €250M 2018 hit on revisions of Belgian nuclear units

    • Engie (OTCPK:ENGIY -4.9%) says it expects to record a €250M ($289M) hit to its 2018 earnings after adjusting the revision program for three nuclear units.
    • Engie says the revisions represent the equivalent of more than seven additional cumulative non-operating months in 2018 for an equivalent of a second generation unit, with no impact on 2019.
    • Engie’s Belgian unit Electrabel says it will revise the agenda of the scheduled revisions of the Tihange 2 and Doel 4 nuclear units and extend the closure of the Tihange 3 plant because of problems with deteriorating concrete.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • RYTM

    Rhythm Pharma's setmelanotide shows positive action in rare obesity disorders; investors unmoved, shares down 9%

    • Thinly traded Rhythm Pharmaceuticals (RYTM -8.7%) is down on below average volume on the heels of its announcement of new data from basket studies of MC4R receptor agonist setmelanotide in patients with rare inherited obesity disorders.
    • Four patients with Bardet-Biedl Syndrome (BBS) treated with setmelanotide experienced an average weight loss of 18.5% with an average decrease on hunger score of 74.2%.
    • The first patient with Alström Syndrome (AS) experienced a 23.2% loss in weight and 45.5% decrease in hunger score.
    • Two patients with pro-opiomelanocortin (POMC) and other MC4 pathway heterozygous deficiency obesities experienced weight losses of 15.4% and 6.5%, respectively, during treatment.
    • A combined study in BBS and AS should launch by year-end.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • MDLY

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/18/2018)

    • Gainers: MDLY +10%.
    • Losers: HX -21%. LYL -11%. BBDO -11%. BFR -9%. SUPV -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • CLR

    Continental Resources' Hamm pulls out of OPEC meeting

    • Continental Resources (CLR +2.7%) says CEO and founder Harold Hamm has canceled a scheduled appearance at this week's OPEC meeting in Vienna, leaving only two U.S. shale executives set to speak at the event out of an original five.
    • Hamm's withdrawal comes days after trade tensions between the U.S. and China intensified, with China imposing $50B in retaliatory tariffs on U.S. crude oil and other goods; CLR has been a key supplier of crude oil to China, shipping more than 1M barrels to the country since a U.S. crude export ban was lifted in 2015.
    • Centennial Resource Development (CDEV +3.1%) CEO Mark Papa and ConocoPhillips (COP +2.9%) CEO Ryan Lance earlier withdrew from the OPEC event; Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +1%) Executive Chairman Scott Sheffield and Hess (HES +2.4%) CEO John Hess are still scheduled to attend.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 14 Comments
  • GEVO

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/18/2018)

    • Gainers: GEVO +236%. OTCPK:LFIN +48%. PTCT +26%. OBSV +26%. ARWR +23%. RCII +22%. VSTM +22%. CBPO +22%. QTNT +19%. EGC +19%.
    • Losers: CBIO -58%. AMBO -22%. HX -22%. NFEC -19%. ZIOP -18%. NVIV -18%. EARS -17%. AGMH -16%. CYTK -15%. BTE -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • CYTK

    Cytokinetics down 15% as mid-stage data on SMA drug reldesemtiv fails to excite investors

    • Thinly traded Cytokinetics (CYTK -15.2%) slumps on almost triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 835K shares, in response to its announcement of Phase 2 proof-of-concept data on reldesemtiv in patients with spinal muscular atrophy (SMA). The results were presented at the Annual Cure SMA Conference in Dallas, TX.
    • SMA patients receiving 150 mg of reldesemtiv showed a 10.86-meter increase in six-minute walk distance (6MWD) versus placebo after four weeks of treatment, although this moderated to 7.72 meters after eight weeks of treatment. Patients receiving 450 mg experienced an increase of 35.63 meters versus placebo at week 4, but eased to 24.89 meters at week 8. The 450 mg/4 week result was the only one that was statistically significant.
    • Other metrics also showed statistically valid correlations with particular doses of the drug compared to placebo.
    • Reldesemtiv is a next-generation fast skeletal troponin activator.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • GMGI

    Golden Matrix Group slides 10% post Q3 results

    • Golden Matrix Group (OTCPK:GMGI -10%) reports Q3 revenue growth of 1066.7% Y/Y to $0.35M, the jump in revenue was primarily a result of only two months of activities from the newly acquired technology.
    • The loss reported in Q3 was adversely impacted by two noncash charges related to the acquisition of proprietary gaming technology by the company - along with a licensing and distribution agreement to monetize its deployment. These charges were an amortization expense of $0.07M and G&A related-party expenses of $0.3M for stock issued to acquire the proprietary technology.
    • The company entered into an Asset Purchase Agreement to acquire the unique gaming technology, along with certain intellectual property and know-how, from Luxor Capital LLC.
    • Also, entered into a definitive license and distribution agreement with Articulate.
    • Subscription agreement with certain individual investors was carried out in which the Company sold 0.3B shares of restricted common stock, and received non-brokered gross proceeds of $0.12M.
    • “We are confident that the current and future quarters will be generating solid, recurring monthly sales and positive cash flow, and we expect our ongoing marketing efforts to add more social gaming operators and contribute to profitable operating results.” said Anthony Goodman, CEO.
    • Previously: Golden Matrix Group reports Q3 results (June 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • SATS

    Inmarsat +2.6% on report EchoStar weighs boosting takeout offer

    • After getting spurned with a previous bid, EchoStar (NASDAQ:SATS) is looking at raising an offer to buy rival Inmarsat (OTCPK:IMASY), Bloomberg reports.
    • OTCPK:IMASY is up 2.6%; SATS down 0.8%.
    • The firm is talking with financial advisers and discussing financing to boost its bid, though a final decision hasn't been made, according to the report.
    • Inmarsat had rejected a previous bid 10 days ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • DRYS

    DryShips pulls out of Gas Ships spinoff, sells two Panamaxes for $18.8M

    • DryShips (DRYS +3.3%) is higher after saying it will not proceed with plans to spin off its Gas Ships gas carrier business, and has withdrawn the F-1 statement with the SEC.
    • DRYS announced the spinoff plan in February, in which it would have retained a 51% stake in the business with shareholders taking a 49% stake in the newly public company.
    • DRYS also agrees to sell two of its older Panamax drybulk carriers to unspecified buyers for a combined $18.8M.
    • The company continues to operate a fleet of 36 vessels, including 11 Panamax drybulk vessels.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 23 Comments
  • HSDT

    Helios to file U.S. marketing application for PoNS device in Q3

    • Thinly traded micro cap Helius Medical Technologies (HSDT -2.8%) announces that it expects to file a marketing application with the FDA next quarter seeking 510(k) clearance under de novo status for its Portable Neuromodulation Stimulator (PoNS).
    • The device enables tongue-delivered neuromodulation, combined with cranial nerve stimulation and physical and cognitive therapy, to restore lost neurological function.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • NAKD

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (06/18/2018)

    • Gainers: NAKD +11%. VNCE +10%. NBEV +7%.
    • Losers: PPC -7%. FAMI -6%. FUV -6%. CRESY -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • IMGN

    ImmunoGen's mirvetuximab soravtansine Fast Track'd for treatment-resistant ovarian cancer; shares up 5%

    • ImmunoGen (IMGN +4.9%) is up on below-average volume on the heels of its announcement that the FDA has granted Fast Track status for antibody-drug conjugate mirvetuximab soravtansine for the treatment of patients with medium-to-high folate receptor alpha-positive platinum-resistant ovarian cancer who have received at least one, but no more than three, prior lines of systemic therapy and for whom single-agent chemo is appropriate as the next line of treatment.
    • Fast Track status provides for more frequent interaction with the FDA review team and a rolling review of the marketing application.
    • Topline data from the Phase 3 FORWARD I study should be available in H1 2019.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • PBYA

    Probility Media jumps 26% on Q2 results

    • ProBility Media (OTCQB:PBYA +26.2%) reported Q2 revenue growth of 118% Y/Y to $4.02M, increase was due to sales from acquired companies that realized a total of $2.16M in sales.
    • Q2 Gross margin improved by 357 bps to 41.1% as the company shifted product focus from printed materials to higher margin training and eLearning products.
    • Total operating expenses were $2.89M (+119.2% Y/Y) due to increase in cost of sales from acquisitions.
    • Q2 Net loss was $4.36M compared to $0.51M in prior year, reflecting the impact by the change in the derivative liability, a noncash expense, and higher interest expense due to higher note balances.
    • Disco Learning Media secured a contract with the State of Texas for the development of a series of new STEM programs and also renewed contract with the Minnesota Historical Society.
    • “As we continue to execute on our growth strategy we believe we have the opportunity to explore more advantageous forms of financing with the intention of a more positive impact on our balance sheet. We believe that our second-quarter results validate both our growth strategy, and the ongoing acceptance of ProBility as a leading provider of educational and training materials within the industrial trades”, mentioned Evan Levine, CEO.
    • Previously: Probility Media reports Q2 results (June 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • MYGN

    FDA accepts Myriad Genetics' application for BRACAnalysis CDx as companion diagnostic with Pfizer's talazoparib, action date December; shares up 1%

    • The FDA accepts under Priority Review Myriad Genetics' (MYGN +0.8%) marketing application seeking approval to use its BRACAnalysis CDx test as a companion diagnostic with Pfizer's (PFE -1.3%) PARP inhibitor talazoparib. The agency's action date is in December.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • NOK

    Nokia -1.8% in U.S. trade as Santander cuts to Underweight

    • Shares of Nokia (NYSE:NOK) are 1.8% lower in NYSE trading today after a downgrade to Underweight at Santander.
    • The bank updated its price target higher, to €5.40; that's about 4.7% upside from today's close in Helsinki of €5.16.
    • It's one of just a few Sell-level ratings against more than a dozen Buys, though.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 13 Comments
  • OBSV

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (06/18/2018)

    • Gainers: OBSV +34%. CBPO +24%. PTCT +22%. VSTM +19%. ARWR +18%.
    • Losers: CBIO -56%. NVIV -16%. CYTK -16%. ZIOP -14%. NSPR -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • DIS

    Disney -1.5% as Pivotal goes to Sell amid Fox-deal bumps

    • Disney's (NYSE:DIS) off 1.5% following a morning downgrade to Sell from Pivotal Research, and amid news that the company is looking to add cash to its Fox media-asset bid to ward off an all-cash offer from Comcast.
    • Pivotal's Brian Wieser notes the damned-if-you do, damned-if-you-don't nature of the Fox fight: Paying more for the Fox assets would definitely "reduce the value of Disney to its shareholders"; meanwhile, without the deal its strategic position is weaker without expected synergies.
    • Disney can still emphasize a direct-to-consumer approach without the Fox assets, but its propositions both to viewers and to content creators is stronger with Fox. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Wieser's price target is at $93, vs. Disney's current price of $107.25 (13.3% downside).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 24 Comments
  • AMBO

    Ambow Education peels off 19% in share price

    • Ambow Education (NYSEMKT:AMBO) is down 19.2% to $5.94 as the education stock cools off a bit from last week's rocket ride.
    • The company hasn't posted any news or SEC filings to account for the shift in sentiment.
    • Ambow priced its public offering of shares at $4.25 per ADS on June 1.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • MSFT

    Microsoft acquires video sharing platform for education

    • Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) announces acquiring Flipgrid, a video sharing platform for students and educators, for an undisclosed amount.
    • Microsoft will make Flipgrid free for schools compared to the previous subscription plans of $40/year for educators, $800/year for school districts, and $1,000/year for schools. Customers who already paid for a subscription will receive a prorated refund. 
    • Flipgrid has more than 20M teachers and students in 180 countries using the platform.
    • The acquisition helps Microsoft move deeper into the educational market dominated by Google. In the US, nearly 60% of mobile personal computing devices shipped to schools in Q4 were Chromebooks, according to Futuresource data, and less than 26% ran Windows. 
    • Microsoft shares are up 0.7% to $100.78.  
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 8 Comments
  • TSG

    The Stars Group -6% after share offering

    • The Stars Group (NASDAQ:TSG) is down 6.34% after announcing a share offering earlier today.
    • The company is using the funds to pay for the acquisition of Sky Betting & Gaming. If the Sky deal doesn't make it to the finish line, the company will use the funds for general corporate purposes.
    • Shares of TSG are still up 53% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 4 Comments
  • Z

    Zillow -3.5% as Goldman cools on online real estate

    • Zillow Group (NASDAQ:Z) is 3.5% lower after a cut to Neutral at Goldman Sachs.
    • Analyst Heath Terry is expecting seasonal underperformance in the sector, and Zillow has already "significantly" outperformed year-to-date (it's up 60.2% in that time frame). Housing and mortgage availability should continue to be tight as well.
    • Terry has a price target of $60, implying 5.1% downside from today's lower price. The firm downgraded Redfin to Sell.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • PPC

    Near-term challenges for Pilgrim's Pride and Sanderson Farms

    • Stephens warns on some near-term challenges on Pilgrim's Pride (PPC -5.6%) in a new research report, while keeping a positive view on the long-term potential for the poultry stock.
    • The investment firm has PPC rated at Overweight with a price target of $26 (30% upside potential).
    • Pilgrim's Pride and Sanderson Farms (SAFM -1.1%) are both lower today on tariff anxiety.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • IBXNF

    Ibex Technologies slides 22.1% post Q3 results

    • Ibex Technologies (OTC:IBXNF) reports Q3 revenue growth of 27.3% Y/Y to C$1.4M, the increase in revenues represents a resumption of purchases by one of major customers who had excess inventory in the Q1 & Q2 2018.
    • As a consequence of the increase in revenues, offset by an increase in expenses, the company recorded EBITDA of $0.3M (+275% Y/Y).
    • There were no capital expenditures for Q3 as compared year ago, the year-ago expenditures trace to the construction of the new Montréal fermentation facility.
    • Cash & equivalents was C$2.7M (-10.1% Y/Y); Net working capital of C$3.5M (-4.1% Y/Y) & Net earnings C$0.2M
    • The Company continues to work on a number of projects with its key customers, some of which may result in additional revenues in 2019 and beyond; however, as with all developmental projects, there is no assurance that any of these projects will come to fruition and produce revenues.
    • Previously: Ibex Technologies reports 9M results (June 18)

    AT&T launches new generation of DirecTV for Business

    • AT&T (T -1.8%) has taken advantage of the HITEC Houston hospitality-tech show to roll out the third iteration of its DirecTV for Business platform.
    • The COM3000 video headend now offers up to 138 HD channels, including 4K programming, and allows business owners to add channels one at a time, including in-house and OTT channels.
    • It also allows for easier software upgrades to save hardware costs (while hotels will likely be the biggest beneficiary, it's optimal for any business with a lot of TVs that doesn't want a receiver at each set) and adds flexibility for guests viewing content on various devices through a number of different wiring schemes.

  • TGTX

    TG Therapeutics slips 2% on mid-stage umbralisib data in treatment-resistant CLL

    • TG Therapeutics (TGTX -1.5%) is down on light volume on the heels of its announcement of preliminary data from a Phase 2 clinical trial assessing PI3K inhibitor umbralisib (TGR-1202) in patients with relapsed/refractory chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) who were intolerant to prior BTK or PI3K therapy (up to 40% of patients according to CEO Michael Weiss). The data were presented at EHA in Stockholm.
    • 13% of patients receiving umbralisib discontinued treatment due to an adverse event, including one also experienced an adverse event with prior kinase inhibitor therapy.
    • Median progression-free survival (PFS) and overall survival (OS) had not been reached (median follow-up: 9.5 months).
    • "Significant clinical activity" was observed in this group of which 77% required treatment with six months of discontinuation of prior kinase inhibitor therapy, 64% had a high-risk molecular or genetic biomarker and 6% had a resistance mutation to AbbVie's Imbruvica (ibrutinib).
    • Topline data from the Phase 3 UNITY-CLL study assessing the combination of umbralisib and ublituximab (TG-1101) compared to Roche's Gazyva (obinutuzumab) + chlorambucil in treatment-naive and treatment-experienced CLL patients should be available in the September time frame.
    • Previously: Verastem's duvelisib shows significant treatment effect in CLL study; shares up 14% premarket (June 18)

    • Other semiconductor equipment stocks that could move on the note: Applied Materials (AMAT -1.5%),  ASML (ASML -2.6%), Brooks Automation (BRKS -5.8%), AXT (AXTI), Nanometrics (NANO -2.5%), Nova Measuring Instruments (NVMI -1.6%), Axcelis Technologies (ACLS -0.5%), Ambarella (AMBA -1.2%), Universal Display (OLED -2.1%), Synopsys (SNPS -1.4%), and Teradyne (TER -1.5%).

  • VSTM

    Verastem's duvelisib shows significant treatment effect in CLL study; shares up 14% premarket

    • Verastem (NASDAQ:VSTM) is up 14% premarket on robust volume on the heels of its announcement of positive results from a Phase 1b/2 clinical trial assessing duvelisib, combined with a chemo regimen called FCR, for the first-line treatment in younger patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL). The data were presented at EHA in Stockholm.
    • The objective response rate was 94% with 76% of patients achieving bone marrow minimal residual disease (MRD) negativity. The complete response rate was 26% and the partial response rate was 68%.
    • Data from the crossover extension phase of the Phase 3 DUO study in patients with treatment-resistant CLL/small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL) showed an ORR of 73%.
    • Duvelisib is a dual inhibitor of two enzymes called phosphoinositide 3-kinase (PI3K)-delta and PI3K-gamma. Both are associated with the growth and survival of malignant B cells and T cells.
    • Previously: Verastem submits U.S. marketing application for lead candidate duvelisib; shares ahead 7% premarket (Feb. 7)

    • Over 90% of SMA babies treated with risdiplam, a splicing modifier that targets the survival motor neuron 2 RNA, achieved more than a four-point increase in a test of motor skills called CHOP-INTEND. The median increase was 5.5 points.
    • The company says babies with Type 1 SMA typically do not experience functional motor milestone improvements based on natural history.

  • GERN

    Geron shows positive effect in Phase 2/3 MDS study; shares up 5% premarket

    • Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) is up 5% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a Phase 2/3 clinical trial, iMerge, evaluating imetelstat in lower-risk myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS). The data were presented at EHA in Stockholm.
    • In 32 red blood cell transfusion-dependent patients at baseline, 34% (n=11/32) achieved transfusion independence (TI) for at least eight weeks with a median duration of TI of 23.1 weeks. 16% (n=5/32) achieved TI for at least 24 weeks with a median duration of more than one year.
    • Average relative reduction in transfusion burden from baseline was 60%.
    • Imetelstat inhibits an enzyme called telomerase by binding to its RNA template. Most cancers have a high level of telomerase activity and relatively short telemeres (caps at the end of each strand of DNA) compared to normal cells. Inhibiting telomerase inhibits the proliferation of malignant progenitor cells.
    • The company expects a decision from licensee Janssen next quarter on whether it will continue development of imetelstat.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:28 AM | 108 Comments
